EPIC: Airbnb.com Translation (Adding Hindi, Hebrew, and Arabic) with TMS and CMS Integration

As a global hospitality company, we want to add Hindi, Hebrew, and Arabic languages to our website, so that we can cater to a wider audience and provide a localized experience.

Capability: Localization and Translation Management

Feature User Story:
As a user of Airbnb.com, I want to be able to access the website content in Hindi, Hebrew, and Arabic, so that I can easily find and book accommodations that are relevant to my needs.

Acceptance Criteria:

* Integration with a Translation Management System (TMS) to manage the translation process for all website content.
* Integration with a Content Management System (CMS) to manage the creation and publishing of new content in multiple languages.
* Automatic URL rewrites based on language, so that each language-specific version of the page has its own unique URL.
* Support for localized images, videos, and other media.
* Ability to track and manage translated content and update as necessary.
* Ability to preview content in different languages before publishing.
* Integration with web analytics tools to track the performance of the website in each language.
* Ensure that the translated content is culturally relevant and sensitive.
* Ensure that the design of the website can accommodate right-to-left text direction in Hebrew and Arabic.

Test Cases:

1. Verify that the language selector is present on each page of the website and allows the user to switch between available languages, including Hindi, Hebrew, and Arabic.
2. Verify that each language-specific version of the page has a unique URL based on the selected language.
3. Verify that all website content is translatable and that translations can be managed using the TMS.
4. Verify that new content can be created and published in Hindi, Hebrew, and Arabic using the CMS.
5. Verify that images, videos, and other media are properly localized on each language-specific version of the page.
6. Verify that the translated content can be previewed before publishing.
7. Verify that web analytics tools can track and report on the performance of the website in each language.
8. Verify that translated content is culturally relevant and sensitive to the target audience.
9. Verify that the design of the website can accommodate right-to-left text direction in Hebrew and Arabic.
10. Verify that the translation process is efficient and meets the desired quality standards.

Feature User Story:
As a user of Airbnb.com, I want to be able to search for accommodations in Hindi, Hebrew, and Arabic, so that I can find and book accommodations that are relevant to my needs.

Acceptance Criteria:

* The search function should be available in Hindi, Hebrew, and Arabic languages.
* The search results should display properties that match the search criteria and are available in the selected language.
* The search results should include descriptions and images of the properties in the selected language.
* The booking process should be available in the selected language.

3. Verify that the search results include descriptions and images of the properties in the selected language.
4. Verify that the booking process is available in the selected language.
5. Verify that the booking process is localized to the selected language, including currency and date formats.

EPIC: Exlibrisgroup.com Translation for Global Expansion

Capability: Multilingual Translation and Localization

User Story: As a user, I want to access exlibrisgroup.com in my preferred language so that I can easily browse and understand the website content.

Acceptance Criteria:

* The website should be translated into Hindi, Hebrew, and Arabic languages.
* The language of the website should be determined automatically based on the user's browser settings or the user can manually select the language from the language selector.
* All website content including text, images, and multimedia should be translated accurately with correct grammar and sentence structure.
* The translated website should maintain the same layout and design as the original website.
* All translated content should be consistent across the website, including header, footer, and other sections.
* Users should be able to switch between different language versions of the website seamlessly without any disruption or loss of data.
* The translated website should be optimized for search engines in each language, including proper keywords, meta descriptions, and titles.
* The website should also support right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.
* The translated website should comply with the legal and cultural requirements of each region where it is being offered.

Test Cases:

1. Verify that the language selector is working correctly and all supported languages are listed.
2. Verify that the website content is correctly translated and displayed in the selected language.
3. Verify that the translated website layout and design is the same as the original website.
4. Verify that switching between different language versions of the website is seamless and no data is lost during the switch.
5. Verify that the translated website is optimized for search engines in each language.
6. Verify that the translated website supports right-to-left languages like Arabic and Hebrew.
7. Verify that the translated website complies with the legal and cultural requirements of each region where it is being offered.
8. Verify that there are no broken links or 404 errors on the translated website.
